item.title: George R R Martin eyeing 'Game of Thrones' movie franchise
item.description: Best-selling author George R R Martin is very keen on a big screen adaptation of 'Game of Thrones'

item.title: Rooney Mara's casting in 'Peter Pan' movie causes controversy
item.description: A petition has asked Warner Bros to "stop casting white actors to play people of color"

item.title: Barkhad Abdi in talks to join â€˜Trainwreck'
item.description: Oscar-nominated actor Barkhad Abdi 'Trainwreck' might join Amy Schumer, Bill Hader and Brie Larson for Judd Apatow's 'Trainwreck'

item.title: Obama teases Ellen on Oscar selfie stunt
item.description: "I thought it was a pretty cheap stunt," said U.S President Barack Obama

item.title: Designer L'Wren Scott committed suicide by hanging: Official
item.description: "I am still struggling to understand how my lover and best friend could end her life in this tragic way," said boyfriend Mick Jagger

item.title: Ryan Gosling to play Busby Berkeley?
item.description: Hollywood superstar Ryan Gosling might produce and star in Busby Berkeley biopic

item.title: Ali Fazal to join 'Fast & Furious 7' team in Abu Dhabi
item.description: Bollywood actor Ali Fazal is set to join Vin Diesel, Dwayne Johnson and Jason Statham

item.title: New 'Star Wars' film to be set 30 years after 'Return of the Jedi'
item.description: Walt Disney Co.'s chief executive officer Bob Iger reveals details about J.J. Abrams' 'Star Wars: Episode VII'

item.title: Stan Lee launches new superhero in English, Hindi
item.description: "Against the spectacular backdrop of Mumbai, we tell the incredible saga of Chakra, one of my latest and most exciting superhero creations," said comic book legend Stan Lee

item.title: Evil frog spawns international mayhem in 'Muppets Most Wanted'
item.description: 'Muppets Most Wanted', starring Tina Fey and Ricky Gervais, hearkens back to satirical 1960s international heist films

item.title: Mick Jagger pays tribute to L'Wren Scott
item.description: "I will never forget her," said Rolling Stones star Mick Jagger

item.title: Scarlett Johansson calls Dylan Farrow's essay irresponsible
item.description: Scarlett Johansson, who will be seen next in 'Captain America: The Winter Soldier', addresses Woody Allen controversy

item.title: Shailene Woodley was self-conscious about being skinny
item.description: 'Divergent' star Shailene Woodley talks about being skinny, her relationship status and George Clooney

item.title: It's easy to work with George Clooney: Dujardin
item.description: Actor Jean Dujardin talks about working with the cast of 'The Monuments Men'

item.title: Paul Walker was a great actor: David Belle
item.description: 'Brick Mansions' actor David Belle talks about late actor Paul Walker

item.title: Review: 'Need For Speed'
item.description: Scott Waugh's 'Need For Speed', starring Aaron Paul, Dominic Cooper, Imogen Poots, Michael Keaton, Scott Mescudi, Rami Malek, Ramon Rodriguez and Dakota Johnson, is engaging and entertaining

item.title: Review: 'Muppets Most Wanted'
item.description: A detailed appraisal of James Bobin's 'Muppets Most Wanted', starring Ricky Gervais, Ty Burrell, Tina Fey, Tom Hiddleston, Salma Hayek, Christoph Waltz, Stanley Tucci, Jemaine Clement and Danny Trejo

item.title: Review: '3 Days To Kill'
item.description: A detailed appraisal of McG's '3 Days To Kill', starring Kevin Costner, Hailee Steinfeld, Amber Heard, Connie Nielsen and Eriq Ebouaney

item.title: Review: 'August Osage County'
item.description: John Wells' 'August Osage County', starring Meryl Streep, Julia Roberts, Ewan McGregor, Chris Cooper, Sam Shepard, Benedict Cumberbatch, Juliette Lewis, Abigail Breslin, Margo Martindale, Chris Cooper, Dermot Mulroney and Julianne Nicholson, is a rich brew of drama

item.title: Review: '300: Rise of an Empire'
item.description: Director Noam Murro's '300: Rise of an Empire', starring Sullivan Stapleton, Eva Green, Lena Headey, Hans Matheson, Callan Mulvey, Rodrigo Santoro, Jack O'Connell, Andrew Tiernan, Igal Naor and Andrew Pleavin, is a mediocre vengeance drama

item.title: Review: 'Non-Stop'
item.description: Jaume Collet-Serra's 'Non-Stop', starring Liam Neeson, Julianne Moore, Scoot McNairy, Michelle Dockery, Nate Parker, Corey Stoll, Lupita Nyong'o, Omar Metwally, Jason Butler Harner, Linus Roache, Shea Whigham and Anson Mount, is a formulaic tense drama

item.title: Review: 'The Monuments Men'
item.description: George Clooney's 'The Monuments Men', starring Matt Damon, Bill Murray, John Goodman, Jean Dujardin, Bob Balaban, Hugh Bonneville, Cate Blanchett and Dimitri Leonidas, is a monumental mess

item.title: Review: 'Pompeii'
item.description: Paul W.S. Anderson's 'Pompeii', starring Kit Harington, Emily Browning, Jared Harris, Carrie-Anne Moss, Adewale Akkinnuoye-Agbaje, Jessica Lucas and Kiefer Sutherland, is a visual spectacle

item.title: Review: 'RoboCop'
item.description: Jose Padilha's 'RoboCop', starring Joel Kinnaman, Gary Oldman, Michael Keaton, Abbie Cornish, Jackie Earle Haley, Michael K. Williams, Jennifer Ehle, Jay Baruchel, Marianne Jean-Baptiste and Samuel L. Jackson, lacks momentum

item.title: Review: 'Vampire Academy'
item.description: Mark Waters' 'Vampire Academy', starring Zoey Deutch, Lucy Fry, Danila Kozlovsky, Dominic Sherwood and Gabriel Byrne, is limp and devoid of fangs

item.title: Review: 'Her'
item.description: Spike Jonze's 'Her', starring Joaquin Phoenix, Amy Adams, Rooney Mara, Olivia Wilde, Chris Pratt, Matt Letscher, Portia Doubleday and Scarlett Johansson, is a heartfelt romantic tale with brilliant actors

item.title: Review: 'The Lego Movie'
item.description: Christopher Miller and Phil Lord's 'The Lego Movie', featuring the voices of Chris Pratt, Will Ferrell, Elizabeth Banks, Will Arnett, Liam Neeson and Morgan Freeman, is a universally loveable film

item.title: Review: 'Lone Survivor'
item.description: Peter Berg's 'Lone Survivor', starring Mark Wahlberg, Ben Foster, Taylor Kitsch, Emile Hirsch, Ali Suliman and Alexander Ludwik, is a glorified war memorial

item.title: Review: 'Saving Mr. Banks'
item.description: A detailed appraisal of John Hancock's 'Saving Mr. Banks', starring Emma Thompson, Tom Hanks, Paul Giamatti, Jason Schwartzman, Colin Farrell, Bradley Whitford, Ruth Wilson, B.J. Novak, Rachel Griffiths, Dendrie Taylor, Kathy Baker, Victoria Summer, Ronan Vibert, Annie Buckley and Melanie Paxson

item.title: Review: '12 Years a Slave'
item.description: Steve McQueen's '12 Years a Slave', starring Chiwetel Ejiofor, Michael Fassbender, Benedict Cumberbatch, Brad Pitt, Lupita Nyong'o, Alfre Woodard, Adepero Oduye, Paul Dano and Sarah Paulson, is hauntingly disturbing

item.title: Review: 'Mandela: Long Walk To Freedom'
item.description: Justin Chadwick's 'Mandela: Long Walk To Freedom', starring Idris Elba, Deon Lotz, Naomie Harris and Terry Pheto, lacks emotional drive

item.title: Review: 'The Legend of Hercules'
item.description: Renny Harlin's 'The Legend of Hercules', starring Kellan Lutz, Scott Adkins, Liam McIntyre, Liam Garrigan, Johnathon Schaech, Roxana McKee, Gaia Weiss, Rade Serbedzija, Kenneth Cranham, Mariah Gale and Luke Newberry, leaves viewers gasping for meaningful cinema

item.title: Review: 'American Hustle'
item.description: David O. Russell's 'American Hustle', starring Christian Bale, Bradley Cooper, Amy Adams, Jeremy Renner, Jennifer Lawrence, Louis C.K., Jack Huston, Michael Pena, Elisabeth Rohm, is a well-crafted crime buster

item.title: Review: 'Grudge Match'
item.description: Peter Segal's 'Grudge Match', starring Sylvester Stallone, Robert De Niro, Kim Basinger, Kevin Hart, Alan Arkin and Jon Bernthal, is packed with adult humour

item.title: Review: 'The Wolf of Wall Street'
item.description: Martin Scorsese's 'The Wolf of Wall Street', starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Jonah Hill, Margot Robbie, Mathew McConaughey, Rob Reiner and Joanna Lumley, is an over-egged pudding, but worth it.
